plugins.name: SmartTableFill
plugins.description:
SmartTableFill is a GPT-powered plugin designed for intelligent table population with contextual data. Unlike basic data fillers, SmartTableFill analyzes existing content to generate relevant entries, making it ideal for tasks like: creating email addresses based on user names, generating addresses aligned with specified cities, or calculating percentages based on given numbers.


Choose between basic and contextual modes to quickly populate tables for mockups, prototyping, and presentations. Customizable settings allow you to target specific text nodes, saving time on manual entry and bringing a smarter approach to data generation.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly populate tables with smart, contextual data using GPT

plugins.name: Text With Styles
plugins.description:
# Flutter Text Style Inspector


A powerful Figma plugin that bridges the gap between Figma text styles and Flutter's Material Design text theme system. This plugin helps developers and designers maintain consistency between Figma designs and Flutter implementations by automatically mapping Figma text styles to their corresponding Flutter TextTheme properties.


## Features


### Real-time Style Inspection

- Instantly view text style information for any selected text layer

- Live updates as you select different text elements

- Support for multiple text selection with smart duplicate filtering


### Comprehensive Style Information

- Displays the complete Figma text style name

- Shows associated color token information

- Previews the actual text content

- Automatically generates corresponding Flutter TextTheme code


### Smart Flutter Code Generation

- Automatically maps Figma text styles to Flutter's Material Design text theme

- Supports all standard Material text styles:

- Headlines (Large, Medium, Small)

- Titles (Large, Medium, Small)

- Body text (with weight variations)

- Labels (Large, Medium, Small)

- Includes font weight handling for body styles (w400, w500, w600)


### User-Friendly Interface

- Clean, organized display of style information

- Easy-to-copy Flutter code snippets

- Compact, floating UI that stays out of your way

- Simple click-outside-to-close functionality


## How to Use


1. Select any text layer(s) in your Figma design

2. The plugin will automatically display:

- The applied Figma text style

- The color token (if available)

- A preview of the text content

- The equivalent Flutter TextTheme code

3. Copy the generated Flutter code directly into your application


## Best Practices


- Name your Figma text styles to match Material Design conventions for automatic mapping

- Use consistent style names to ensure accurate Flutter code generation

- Apply color styles to text layers for complete token information

- Select multiple text layers to quickly inspect all text styles in a component


Perfect for teams working with both Figma and Flutter, this plugin streamlines the handoff process and ensures design consistency across platforms.
plugins.tagline: Select any layer and get its texts with styles

plugins.name: Frame Manager
plugins.description:
A simple but powerful tool for organizing and fixing frames in Figma. Detect duplicates, fix naming issues, and ensure proper dimensions in your design files.

Full Description

Frame Manager helps you maintain clean and well-organized Figma files by providing essential tools for working with frames.

Key Features:

ðŸ” Duplicate Frame Detection & Removal

Instantly find frames with identical names

Option to automatically remove duplicates while keeping one instance

Clean up messy files by eliminating redundant elements

ðŸ·ï¸ Frame Name Standardization

Identify frames with non-standard naming conventions

Automatically fix frame names to follow consistent PascalCase format

Enforce naming consistency across your design system

ðŸ“ Size Optimization

Find frames with dimensions not divisible by 2

Fix frame sizes to ensure clean rendering on various displays

Find frames with non-power-of-2 dimensions for texture optimization

How It Works

Install the plugin and run it from the Plugins menu

Select the feature you need from the simple, intuitive interface

Get instant feedback as the plugin detects issues or fixes problems

Enjoy a cleaner, more organized Figma file

Perfect For

Design teams working on large files

Designers preparing assets for developers

Anyone who wants to maintain consistent naming and sizing in their designs

Technical Details

Lightweight and fast - analyzes your file without lag

Non-destructive - always gives you control over changes

Works with any Figma file containing frames

Maintain better design hygiene and save hours of manual cleanup with Frame Manager!


2025 - WildCard Studios - Art Department
plugins.tagline: Clean & organize frames: find duplicates, fix names, proper dimensions with one-click solutions.

Whether youâ€™re working with ðŸ–¼ï¸ images, ðŸ“ text, ðŸ”² shapes, ðŸ”— paths, â†”ï¸ lines, ðŸ“ groups, or ðŸ“ frames, this plugin provides an intuitive interface to control which elements are visible in your design. This plugin is especially useful for managing complex designs and improving your efficiency in Figma.

plugins.name: Inkblot Notes
plugins.description:
Inkblot Notes by Inkblot

Turn notes from Inkblot sessions into sticky notes in FigJam


New to Inkblot? See how you can simplify your research studies


How it works

1. Enter a session ID

2. Once submitted, all notes from the session are imported and organized by author and session time

You can import notes from multiple sessions into a single FigJam file
plugins.tagline: Turn notes from Inkblot sessions into sticky notes in FigJam

plugins.name: ex-portable
plugins.description:
Ex-portable is a super simple plug-in for Figma that allows you to pull export settings from a main component in a library to an instance. Thatâ€™s all.


Get settings for selected instances

Select the instances you want to apply the export settings from a main component in a library for, and select this command.


Get settings for all instances

Got a lot of instances on your page? Select this command to apply export settings from their main components.
plugins.tagline: Port your export settings from component to instance.

plugins.name: Easy Select
plugins.description:
Easy Select helps you expedite the tedious and repetitive selection workflows with handy 1-click shortcuts.


-> Simply select one item, then:

  1. Select its parent / children / siblings
  2. Select others with the same color, name, size, rotation ...


-> Or, select a few items, then:

  1. Filter down to those with a particular type, name...


-> Save your carefully curated selections as bookmarks for reuse.


-> Restore from a list of historical selections.


For questions or feedback, please email easy-select@smarter.town.
plugins.tagline: The all-in-one selection helper

plugins.name: TapTail
plugins.description:
ðŸ˜Œ No explicit sign-ups, logins or permissions are required to use TapTail. Just run the plugin!


Have you ever wanted to know if the Figma proto you shared was opened? To see where people clicked? To get insights how your proto works? Read on ðŸ‘‡


Use this example prototype created by Figma to try: https://www.figma.com/community/file/915647337333327091/figma-for-beginners-2020-petma-the-social-media-app-for-pets


TapTail brings real usability data into Figma with minimal effort. Install the plugin, create a prototype sharing link, share the link with your subjects and start collecting metrics. Once you collected enough data (at least one session), you will be able to generate a report directly in your prototype's Figma document (on a separate page).


ðŸ’¬ Feedback and questions (I read and reply to every e-mail): laci@taptail.com

â™¥ï¸ Found it useful? A 'Like' would mean the world to me! :)


â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”


Tired of bouncing between Figma and external usability test tools? With TapTail, you can see metrics directly in Figma:

  1. Session details: Total time spent, time to first click , count of unique sessions and more.
  2. Click positions: Numbered circles on each frame show exactly where and in what order users tapped.
  3. Interaction density: How many taps landed on each screen, helping you spot hot and cold zones.
  4. Labels: Add a tag when copying links to know which channel drove each test.


Your original designs stay untouched: all results are exported on a separate page and overlaid on separate layers of your designs' clones.


â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”


ðŸ›Ÿ How to use

A very detailed, step-by-step guide on how to create a sharing link and a report:


Creating a sharing link:

  1. Run the plugin.
  2. Click the blue 'Create' button.
  3. Provide a 'Name' and your Figma prototype's sharing URL (simply copy like you normally would and paste it here) then click the blue 'Create' button at the bottom. Once done, it will show you a list with the created item on top.
  4. Click the item's link icon to copy the TapTail sharing link: it will ask if you'd like to track the link (this is optional but recommended: use only numbers and lowercase, english alphabet letters without spaces).
  5. Click the blue 'Copy link [...]' button. Sharing link is now copied on your clipboard.
  6. Share the link with your test subjects. When they open it in their browser, your prototype will appear like the original Figma prototype (as if you would shared from the figma.com link).


Report generation:

  1. Run the plugin in the same Figma document where the shared prototype is located (this is important â—ï¸).
  2. You can check for new sessions with the 'Refresh' link on the top right corner.
  3. Once you have at least 1 session, you can create a report by pressing the 'Play' button.
  4. A confirmation pop-up will appear first. If you confirm, report generation will start and a loading indicator will appear (normally a report generation takes a few seconds, but could be more depending on your machine's computational capacity and the volume of the collected data).
  5. Report is generated on a new page in the document.


â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”


â³ License & Trial

TapTail is currently in open beta, therefore all features and functions are free for a limited period of time! Feedbacks, questions, bug reports: please and thank you ðŸ¤—


â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”


ðŸ” Data handling & privacy

TapTail does NOT need access to your name, e-mail, files, comments, projects, components or styles to work. It only needs a very limited set of data to function:


Your identity

  1. Your Figma user ID is stored, but only in a scrambled form called a hash. A hash is like a one-way fingerprint: can't turn it back into the real ID. Your ID is needed to assign your account the free license.
  2. Other identity related data is only needed if you buy a license, then at least a billing name, billing address and an e-mail address is required.


Your prototype link

Your Figma prototype sharing URL (copied from Figma, provided by you manually) must be stored so your prototype can be served for your users via the TapTail sharing link (which looks like this: https://ux.taptail.com/s/<handle>). Part of the prototype link is a string called the 'file key' (format: https://www.figma.com/proto/<file key>/â€¦) which identifies your Figma document. Since the prototype sharing URL is stored, the file key is also stored (as part of the URL). Read more about the implications here and here.


Prototype emitted events

List of Figma emitted events that are captured (with timestamp + data such as node ID, click and scroll cooridnates, etc. â€“ for more info, click the event name below):

  1. MOUSE_PRESS_OR_RELEASE
  2. PRESENTED_NODE_CHANGED
  3. INITIAL_LOAD
  4. NEW_STATE
  5. REQUEST_CLOSE
  6. LOGIN_SCREEN_SHOWN
  7. PASSWORD_SCREEN_SHOWN


This data is only used to build your in-Figma reports and are never shared with anyone else.

You can learn more about embeds in general here: Embed Figma Files.


â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”


ðŸš§ Roadmap & new features

In no particular order, directly from my todo list:

  1. define expiration date+time;
  2. define simple instructions/ welcome screen;
  3. designated success screen (to enable missions);
  4. component variant change handling;
  5. data export in structured form (like JSON, CSV, â€¦);
  6. <your ideas maybe? get in touch!>


â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”


ðŸª³ Found a bug? Got feedback? Have an idea for a feature?

E-mail me at laci@taptail.com!

I read and reply to every e-mail :)


â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”


ðŸ«¶ Credits

  1. The prototype used for demo in the video: https://www.figma.com/community/file/915647337333327091/figma-for-beginners-2020-petma-the-social-media-app-for-pets

plugins.name: Sliding Text
plugins.description:
Sliding Text transforms static text into engaging animated components with just a few clicks. This plugin allows designers to:


  1. Convert any text layer into a dynamic text slide component
  2. Customize animation direction (top-to-bottom, bottom-to-top, left-to-right, right-to-left)
  3. Fine-tune animation timing, stagger delay, and easing
  4. Preview animations directly in the plugin interface
  5. Create components that maintain the original text's font, size, and styling
  6. Generate a "done" state for the final animation frame


Simply select a text layer, enter your phrases or words separated by commas, choose your animation settings, and let the plugin generate a fully configured component with smart animate transitions. Perfect for creating engaging sliding text / rotating messages / dynamic text effects without any coding knowledge.
plugins.tagline: Smooth text slide animations with customizable directions and timing

plugins.name: Select Matching Layers in Frame
plugins.description:
Instantly find repeated frames or component instances within the same frame and edit them all at once.


Figmaâ€™s built-in â€œSelect Matching Layersâ€ feature only works across different frames. This plugin is similar but works within a single frame. Quickly select repeating elements within a single frame and adjust their properties, just like the multi-edit feature. For convenience I recommend setting up a custom shortcut for the plugin.


Pair with Master plugin

Turn matching layers into a single component in seconds with the Master plugin:

1. Use Select Matching Layers in Frame to find all repeated elements

2. Run Master â†’ Create Component from Objects

3. Done. Youâ€™ll get a single, clean component with overrides preserved


Technical details:

  1. Select all instances of a component (including variants) when selecting an instance
  2. Select all layers with matching name and type when selecting any other layer
  3. Searches within the same frame only
  4. Select multiple objects within different frames, plugin will find all the matches


If you have any questions or feedback, please comment below!
plugins.tagline: Instantly find, select and edit similar layers within a single frame

plugins.name: Stockpress
plugins.description:
About

Welcome to the Stockpress plugin for Figma, where you can quickly find and add files from your Stockpress workspace to your Figma designs. Once ready, export Frames and images back to Stockpress - complete with Frame URLs for easy access to working files!


What is Stockpress?

Stockpress is a refreshingly simple Digital Asset Management systemâ€“for everyone. One centralized workspace to add, organize, collaborate on, and share files with unlimited users and teams.


How to get started:

  1. First, sign up for a Stockpress workspace (get started for free!)
  2. Upload or import your files and folders to get organized
  3. Install the Stockpress plugin for Figma and connect your account
  4. Easily add files from Stockpress to your Figma designs
  5. Export Frames, images, and/or Frame URLs back to Stockpress


For help, contact us through your in-workspace chat or email us at help@stockpress.co

plugins.name: Easily Name output

Step 1: Export Name Mapping


Prefix the node name with "â–¼". For example: "â–¼page-template".

Enter the Google Sheet URL in the first input field or click the file button to select a file.

The number of nodes must match the number of rows in the uploaded document (excluding the title).

The name mapping should be in the first column, with the column header named "Name".

Specify the corresponding sheet name.

If an XLSX file is selected, the first sheet will be prefilled.

Select the nodes to be exported.

plugins.name: Zero Me
plugins.description:
Zero Me: Center Your Starting Point


Start designing from anywhere on the canvas, and when you're ready, let Zero Me center your creations. Simply select your frames and objects, run the plugin, and Zero Me will position your designs at coordinates (0, 0), keeping your canvas clean and organized.


Zero Me is a small but mighty Figma plugin that simplifies the process of centering and aligning your designs. It's for designers who want to maintain a tidy workspace and ensure a consistent starting point for their projects.


Key Features:

1. Center Alignment: Zero Me sets the position of your selected frames and objects to coordinates (0, 0), providing a centered starting point for your designs.

2. Multiple Object Support: Select multiple frames and objects, and Zero Me will align them all to the center of the canvas.


Install Zero Me and experience the convenience of a centered starting point for your Figma designs.


Created by Taryn + Claude 3 Opus
plugins.tagline: Center you Frames, Objects, Sections, and Self ðŸ§˜
